entry.title: Revert "Fix PDF OCR metrics."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 416f0319cd26755953a05abb770fa5c5825453d2.



Reason for revert:

LUCI Bisection identified this CL as the culprit of a build failure. See the analysis: https://luci-bisection.appspot.com/analysis/b/8772088406438998241



Sample failed build: https://ci.chromium.org/b/8772088406438998241



If this is a false positive, please report it at https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/entry?comment=Analysis%3A+https%3A%2F%2Fluci-bisection.appspot.com%2Fanalysis%2Fb%2F8772088406438998241&components=Tools%3ETest%3EFindit&labels=LUCI-Bisection-Wrong%2CPri-3%2CType-Bug&status=Available&summary=Wrongly+blamed+https%3A%2F%2Fchromium-review.googlesource.com%2Fc%2Fchromium%2Fsrc%2F%2B%2F4793749



Original change's description:

> Fix PDF OCR metrics.

>

> 1- Prevents double recording of:

> - 'Accessibility.PdfOcr.InaccessiblePdfPageCount'

> - 'Accessibility.PdfOcr.ActiveWhenInaccessiblePdfOpened'

> 2- Records 'Accessibility.PdfOcr.InaccessiblePdfPageCount' for all

> inaccessible PDFs regardless of PDF OCR being active or not.

> This is changed to get a better coverage on distribution of

> inaccessible PDFs.

>

> Since this feature is still in prelaunch phase, new UMA metrics are

> not added to replace the previous ones.

>

entry.title: webauthn: fix test ahead of enabling kICloudKeychain.
entry.content:
The test credentials, `kCred1` etc, have a source of `kOther`. But the

platform authenticator added in this test is `kWinNative`. That doesn't

matter until kICloudKeychain is enabled because that trigger this[1]

logic which finds the right platform authenticator given a source.



I had guarded that with a feature flag because it landed close to a

branch point, and we could enable kICloudKeychain only on macOS, but I

think that logic makes sense in general so this change updates a test to

handle it.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/webauthn/authenticator_request_dialog_model.cc;l=1876;drc=3d76769f4a4cea2a854442146d3da421aa768887



Bug: 1439987

entry.title: Fix PDF OCR metrics.
entry.content:
1- Prevents double recording of:

- 'Accessibility.PdfOcr.InaccessiblePdfPageCount'

- 'Accessibility.PdfOcr.ActiveWhenInaccessiblePdfOpened'

2- Records 'Accessibility.PdfOcr.InaccessiblePdfPageCount' for all

inaccessible PDFs regardless of PDF OCR being active or not.

This is changed to get a better coverage on distribution of

inaccessible PDFs.



Since this feature is still in prelaunch phase, new UMA metrics are

not added to replace the previous ones.

entry.title: Add DataConsumePolicy to ServiceWorkerRaceNetworkRequestURLLoaderClient
entry.content:
This is a refactoring CL to simplify the redirect handling in

BestEffortServiceWorker.



Currently, the network request, which is triggered by

BestEffortServiceWorker or ServiceWorkerAutoPreload, doesn't handle the

redirect, and ask the fetch handler to handle it instead. This behavior

was introduced in crrev.com/c/4680667



Before this CL, that behavior is achieved by setting

|FetchResponseFrom::kServiceWorker| in OnReceiveRedirect(), and do not

start teeing response in OnReceiveResponse() when

|FetchResponseFrom::kServiceWorker| is already set.



However, this behavior will be confusing once we land

ServiceWorkerAutoPreload behavior. Because ServiceWorkerAutoPreload is

going to set |FetchResponseFrom::kServiceWorker| in advance, as it

always uses the response from the fetch handler.



After this CL, whether the response data is tee-ed or not is determined

by the new member called `data_consume_policy_`. This is an enum that

specifies tee-ed or not. The default is kTeeResponse, which indicates

teeing data. When a redirect happens, kForwardingOnly is set. That

indicates the response data is only forwarded to the pipe for the fetch

handler, just for the preload/dedupe purpose.



Bug: 1472634, 1420517

Change-Id: Ib4d3c4ffbb285eb0e32f1edb9088eeb05d39d2dd

entry.title: Move SetCaptionStyle out of ArcA11yHelper to ArcIntentHelperService
entry.content:
ChromeOS caption settings are also applied for substitles in default

Javascript video player, therefore it makes sense that Android also

needs to sync subtitles with ChromeOS caption styles.



ArcA11yHelperService is only started when one of the ChromeOS

Accessibility functions was activated, e.g. "Select-to-speak", meanwhile

since subtitle is also treated as "caption", it should be applied

regardless of ArcA11yHelperService being started or not.

entry.title: Reland "Renames `Journeys` in various UI surfaces"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 137d192ed5eb436c6e1f5b57889c73e60025307a.



Reason for revert: Fixes the builder failures by ditching the fieldtrial_testing_config changes in favor of disabling the feature in the test harness. fieldtrial_testing_config is ignored in chrome-branded builders.



Original change's description:

> Revert "Renames `Journeys` in various UI surfaces"

>

> This reverts commit 1cd5666bdc945dc662f68764ed690a841042608f.

>

> Reason for revert: Causing consistent test failures on linux-chromeos-chrome and Win10 Tests x64 builders.

> i.e. https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chrome/builders/ci/linux-chromeos-chrome/35286/test-results?sortby=&groupby=

>

> Original change's description:

> > Renames `Journeys` in various UI surfaces

> >

> > - Updates strings in the History UI, Omnibox suggestion, Side Panel,

> > and NTP Quests behind a flag. Also changes policy string.

> > - Removes the feature visibility toggle in the History UI. The policy

> > can still control the feature visibility. Adds policy browser tests.

entry.title: Reland "Rewrite some aura touch selection browser tests.", part 1.
entry.content:
Partial reland of commit 5177e733b2b7daca6744d0c28718b61730a3add7



In CL:4773898, I tried to rewrite some tests but didn't wait for all

of the necessary selection events in the rewritten tests, resulting in

test failures/flakiness. Will split the original CL into smaller CLs

and be more careful about the changes.



This is part 1, which adds a cursor_index parameter to the helpers

GetPointInText and GetPointInTextfield, to make it easier to test

behaviour which moves the cursor or selection to different parts of the

text.



Original change's description:

> Rewrite some aura touch selection browser tests.

>

> Try to better test end to end functionality and also clean things up a

> bit. Mainly:

>

> 1. Use ui::test::EventGenerator instead of directly creating the touch

> and gesture events and calling rwhva->OnTouchEvent/OnGestureEvent.

>

> 2. Check selection bound values rather than just checking that they are

> non-zero.

>

> 3. Split menu and magnifier test from the handle coordinates test.

>

> Bug: b:295261171

entry.title: Use GetNetworkConnectivityHint for network change notifier
entry.content:
On Windows 10 Build 19041 the GetNetworkConnectivityHint API

provides better and more reliable information about the network

state.



This CL changes the code to use this API instead of using

the older WSALookupServiceBegin API.



GetNetworkConnectivityHint API also works inside App Container

sandbox.



Note: This CL does not fix other issues with network list

determination which are contained in crbug.com/1469771.



This CL also bumps the minimum version for Network sandbox

to Windows 10 Build 19041 to match support for this API. The number

of clients between RS5 and 20H1 is small, so should not affect

sandbox support to a large degree.



This CL also adds a test that the network change notifier works

inside Windows sandbox. The new test dynamically adds a new

adapter to the host, and verifies that a network change

notification is sent from the network service to the browser

process. This test also verifies that the new network adapter can

successfully be enumerated.



BUG=1450754



Change-Id: Ief165ac177c5e65dd1d148245c60889d74a97ff7

entry.title: Lacros: Fix check of source url in Navigate
entry.content:
When deciding whether to reroute navigation to Ash, the Navigate

parameter params->source_contents is inspected. However, this is

done at a point when that value may no longer be the original

incoming value, leading to unexpected behavior. Do the check earlier.



I'm not sure how/if this bug can be triggered at the moment, but a

follow-up CL exposes it.

entry.title: Revert "service worker: ServiceWorkerContextWrapper to maintain browser context"
entry.content:
This reverts commit b53126e0ddd699682d688e18dd1f5aa18aec69a3.



Reason for revert: Causing consistent test failures on Linux Tests (Wayland) builder

i.e. https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20Tests%20(Wayland)/41977/test-results?sortby=&groupby=



Original change's description:

> service worker: ServiceWorkerContextWrapper to maintain browser context

>

> This CL makes ServiceWorkerContextWrapper to maintain the browser

> context by itself rather than having the dependency of

> ServiceWorkerProcessManager. This is to avoid the complication when

> destroying its own members. For example, ServiceWorkerContextCore

> requires a valid browser context during destruction and

> ServiceWorkerContextWrapper ends up needing to be careful on the

> sequence of shutting down ServiceWorkerProcessManager and destroying

> ServiceWorkerContextCore.

>

> Bug: 1473204

> Change-Id: I9a8a82f3e228fda41041be74f88b308e776d8f53

entry.title: [ChromeRefresh2023] Extend tab hit test up (and down) more better.
entry.content:
Extend the bounds of tabs up to the top of the tab strip area, encompassing the tab strip padding above the tab strip. This makes extending the hit test into that region straightforward.



Previously we were hacking tab hit tests somewhat by fudging the test point in the TabContainerImpl, but that didn't cover all code paths (middle/right click most notably). We did that to avoid having to change the bounds of tabs, but it turns out that isn't actually all that hard to do.



This CL also fixes an issue where the padding area under the tab was not included in the hit test, so those clicks were incorrectly treated as frame clicks.

entry.title: [Nearby] Add SaveCredentials method for LocalCredentials.
entry.content:
Added a new method to the credential storage mojom interface

to facilitate saving LocalCredentials to the database. The

implementation of Nearby Presence's credential storage API,

hosted inside of a sandboxed utility process, calls methods

on the NearbyPresenceCredentialStorage implementation,

hosted inside of the browser process, to save credentials generated

by the Nearby Presence library. A full design is given at

go/cros-nearby-presence-credential-storage.



The usage of this interface is demonstrated in a follow-up

CL, based on top of this one; https://crrev.com/c/4794573.



Test: Added new unit tests.

entry.title: Revert "Update Chromium to use VMA 3.0"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 39d7f0daabd13c913865b2a583d6da21d77a5f70.



Reason for revert: Suspicious of causing many test failures related to vulkan

i.e. https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20MSan%20Tests/42533/test-results?sortby=&groupby=



Original change's description:

> Update Chromium to use VMA 3.0

>

> Following the change in ANGLE to add support for VMA 3.0, we must

> also update the VMA version used in Chromium. Currently ANGLE supports

> both VMA 2.3 and 3.0, via setting ANGLE_VMA_VERSION which is defined

> based on the build files. In Chromium, since this parameter is not set,

> ANGLE defaults to using VMA 2.3, which results in conflict if only the

> VMA hash is changed.

> * ANGLE CL: https://crrev.com/c/4777337

>

> * Updated the VMA hash in the dependencies to the 3.0 version.

> * Updated the usage of some functions and variables in gpu/vulkan/ to

> be in line with the new VMA changes.

> * Added angle_vma_version to the build files. It is set to allow ANGLE

> to use VMA 3.0.

> * This parameter is added temporarily. When ANGLE removes support for

> VMA 2.3, it can be removed.

>

entry.title: p13n: remove settings_sent_for_update_
entry.content:
When AmbientProviderImpl calls UpdateSettings, it stores the settings

sent to the backend locally. When the call completes successfully, it

caches those settings so that the state can be restored.



Instead of storing the temporary settings locally, the backend should

pass the settings as part of the callback. This ensures that the correct

settings will be cached.



BUG=b:296114840

entry.title: [BRP/clang-plugin] Use |getLocation()| rather than |getEndLoc()|
entry.content:
This is a follow-up of crrev.com/c/4676614.



In the former CL, I assumed |getEndLoc()| and |getLocation()| return the

identical location. However, it turned out they return different ones

if we have an initializer.



Some examples:

- B: |getBeginLoc()|

- L: |getLocation()|

- E: |getEndLoc()|



```

int* field;

^ ^

B L/E

```



```

int* field = nullptr;

^ ^ ^

B L E

```



```

volatile int* [[fake_attribute]] field;

^ ^

B L/E

```



```

[[fake_attribute]] const int* ptrY{0}

^ ^ ^

B L E

```



Among these locations, |getLocation()| best represents the fieldDecl.

This CL rewrites all |getEndLoc()| in `RawPtrHelpers.h` to

|getLocation()|.



This change is flag-guarded behind `raw-ptr-fix-crbug-1449812`.



Bug: 1449812

Change-Id: Icadd0aea534af444d77d7581dd9c8c87af7c8064

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4795957

Reviewed-by: Daniel Cheng

Commit-Queue: Mikihito Matsuura

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1186201}

entry.title: Reland "[omnibox][ml] Remove scoring signals for history fuzzy provider matches."
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 6300f0616a5e5f224e38baaf72a1f0f23e406966



AutocompleteMatch::scoring_signals is an absl::optional pointer.

Previously, clear() was being called on the ScoringSignals struct this

pointed to, which was potentially empty, resulting in a segfault and

crashes.



This CL clears the scoring signals by resetting the absl::optional

instead.



Original change's description:

> [omnibox][ml] Remove scoring signals for history fuzzy provider matches.

>

> The fuzzy provider works by running the bookmark and history quick

> providers with a "corrected" input and applying a penalty proportional

> to the correction amount to the results. The scoring signals are

> populated according to the correct input and leads to an artificially

> inflated model output.

>

> We previously attempted to correct for this by re-applying the penalty

> after re-scoring. This was not sufficient in demoting the fuzzy

> suggestions.

>

> This CL attempts to correct for this by clearing the

> scoring signals in the fuzzy provider, as these are not accurate for

> the actual input, resulting in fuzzy matches no longer being re-scored

> by the model.

>

> Bug: 1472374, 1405555

> Change-Id: I10bd5036179513a156c6e1ba15713ff1b12eb8fa

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4775323

> Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

> Reviewed-by: manuk hovanesian

> Commit-Queue: Angela Yoeurng

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1184412}



Bug: 1472374, 1405555

entry.title: Return value from ::CoInitializeEx not checked in ScopedCOMInitializer.
entry.content:
In chrome/updater we are seeing cases where COM calls arrive on an

incorrect thread, which was supposed to be bound to a

SingleThreadTaskRunner created by calling

base::ThreadPool::CreateCOMSTATaskRunner.



There are reasons to believe that the above thread has never joined

the STA apartment because the thread is already part of an MTA

apartment. Regardless, allowing the code the continue silently in the

presence of this error is hazardous because it can lead to race

conditions or broken program invariants later on.



This CL intends to gather data about the call sites where such an error

is raised and inform a decision to convert the DCHECK to a CHECK in the

future.



Bug: 1473487

Change-Id: I3a4aa1a1bafead7f866c9cbe749df23b62d897db

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4798986

entry.title: [Extensions] Update fileManagerPrivate schemas and bindings for promises
entry.content:
This CL updates the API schemas for fileManagerPrivate and

fileManagerPrivateInternal to add promise support to most of the async

functions contained in them, along with updating the associated custom

bindings between them to better propagate any errors that may occur when

calling the Internal versions of the APIs. Several of the functions have

multi-parameter callbacks which require some extra changes to support,

so they will be updated with promise support separately in a followup.



The error handling in one related test file was also updated as it was

relying on a quirk of the scope in which chrome.runtime.lastError was

still available after awaiting a promise that was resolved with the API

callback.



Bug: 1220910

entry.title: [Extensions] Remove a data member from ExtensionWebRequestEventRouter.
entry.content:
This is one in a series of CLs that will move data out of the

ExtensionWebRequestEventRouter that is not keyed by BrowserContext.

This will allow for a more straightforward approach when breaking it

up into multiple per-BrowserContext instances.



This CL moves the map of blocked requests keyed by request ID into

the BrowserContext-specific data. This is safe because:



1. Request IDs are globally unique.



2. A request ID is generated by and associated with a WebRequestAPI

instance.



3. WebRequestAPI is a keyed service which is associated with a

BrowserContext.



4. The WebRequestAPI instance is also associated with any OTR contexts that belong to the main context.



5. As a result, a BrowserContext not associated with a particular

WebRequestAPI instance should never need access to the BlockingRequest

data associated with a request ID it didn't generate.



Bug: 1433136

Change-Id: I94560ecd25557a09420e976051eb219b5c3e9329

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4787948

entry.content:
This reverts commit 1cd5666bdc945dc662f68764ed690a841042608f.



Reason for revert: Causing consistent test failures on linux-chromeos-chrome and Win10 Tests x64 builders.

i.e. https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chrome/builders/ci/linux-chromeos-chrome/35286/test-results?sortby=&groupby=



Original change's description:

> Renames `Journeys` in various UI surfaces

>

> - Updates strings in the History UI, Omnibox suggestion, Side Panel,

> and NTP Quests behind a flag. Also changes policy string.

> - Removes the feature visibility toggle in the History UI. The policy

> can still control the feature visibility. Adds policy browser tests.

> - Disables the feature in the fieldtrial_testing_config to avoid

> non-trivial changes in the following browser tests:

> - HistoryTest.Metrics

> - HistoryTest.Routing

> - NewTabPageModulesHistoryClustersModuleTest.Core

entry.title: service worker: ServiceWorkerContextWrapper to maintain browser context
entry.content:
This CL makes ServiceWorkerContextWrapper to maintain the browser

context by itself rather than having the dependency of

ServiceWorkerProcessManager. This is to avoid the complication when

destroying its own members. For example, ServiceWorkerContextCore

requires a valid browser context during destruction and

ServiceWorkerContextWrapper ends up needing to be careful on the

sequence of shutting down ServiceWorkerProcessManager and destroying

ServiceWorkerContextCore.



Bug: 1473204

entry.title: Separate network sandbox support from general app container support.
entry.content:
A future CL will bump the minimum version of Windows required for

network sandbox support, as it will need to use a modern API.



This CL separates the network sandbox support from more general

app container sandbox support, allowing the versions to diverge in

the future.



This CL has no functional change, as the OS versions supported by

both the app container sandbox and the network service sandbox remain

the same, for the time being.



BUG=1450754

entry.title: webauthn: handle clicking "Cancel" in iCloud Keychain UI better.
entry.content:
Showing an error dialog when a user clicks "Cancel" on the macOS system

UI is wrong. Instead, if we had dispatched directly to iCloud Keychain

for a create() request, show the mechanism selection sheet in case the

user want to create in the profile authenticator.



In other cases, treat canceling the system UI as if the user had clicked

Cancel in Chrome UI.

entry.title: Switch GL+Graphite tests to Metal+Graphite Mac GPU.FYI CI bots
entry.content:
Since GL+Graphite is not supported.

Also remove the associated test suppressions.

And remove extra sharding of Pixel tests - slowness was fixed.

And add Pixel tests on more bots, since the slowness was fixed.



The bots that were switched from GL+Graphite to Metal+Graphite are:

"Mac FYI ASAN (Intel)" (Pixel tests were added)

"Mac FYI Experimental Release (Intel)"

"Mac FYI Experimental Retina Release (AMD)"

"Mac FYI Release (Apple M1)"

"Mac FYI Release (Intel)"

"Mac FYI Retina Release (AMD)"

"Mac FYI Retina Release (Apple M2)"

"Mac V8 FYI Release (Intel)"



These bots were switched from GL+Graphite to GL+Ganesh,

since we still need to keep testing GL,

and we either don't have enough capacity for Metal and GL (like Debug),

or Metal is not supported (like NVIDIA):

"Mac FYI Debug (Intel)" (Pixel tests were added)

"Mac FYI Experimental Retina Release (NVIDIA)" (Pixel tests were added)

"Mac FYI Retina Debug (AMD)" (Pixel tests were added)

"Mac FYI Retina Release (NVIDIA)" (Pixel tests were added)



Bug: 1423574, 1458020, 1469875, 1474611

entry.title: [OOPIF PDF] Navigate during set up for PDFWebContentsHelperTest
entry.content:
Navigate in SetUpOnMainThread(), instead of at the start of tests.



Some tests need navigation to properly set the content::WebContents. For

OOPIF PDF, PDFWebContentsHelper will be changed to use DocumentUserData

instead. Because of this, the navigation needs to occur during

SetUpOnMainThread(), otherwise the PDFWebContentsHelper object will be

destroyed on navigation.



Also navigate to "about:blank" instead of an empty URL to silence a

warning.



Bug: 1445746

Change-Id: I3ce4e3ae9fb899e682e48cc1a0ebf58c7f09d346

entry.title: [Payment] Check for null data returned from the web database
entry.content:
Before this patch, a disconnected database or unsuccessful read would

return a null unique_ptr to Web Payments, which did not check for null

pointer. This resulted in occasional null pointer dereference crashes.



This patch checks for null unique_ptr being returned from the web

database to Web Payments. In addition, the unique_ptr is being moved

among methods now, instead of passing around a raw pointer.



After this patch, a disconnected database or unsuccessful read do not

cause a null pointer dereference crash.



Bug: 1473982

Change-Id: I7ff9b26539a3c5207dd95987df3a6c70ba0bf9f8

entry.title: Revert "Dictation: Show toast when toggling Dictation fails"
entry.content:
This reverts commit ece65e4b98ac17e1f8767555ded8fd2d78258d10.



Reason for revert: This CL might the culprit that caused browser_tests failure:

NetworkDictationKeyboardImprovementsTest/DictationKeyboardImprovementsTest.ToggledWithNoFocusTriggersSpeech.

The earliest failure can be found at: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20ChromiumOS%20MSan%20Tests/37926/overview.



Original change's description:

> Dictation: Show toast when toggling Dictation fails

>

> This change implements the behavior described in slide 7 of the UX

> mocks [1]. When Dictation fails to toggle because there is no focused

> text field, we now show a toast that explains why Dictation failed.

> To do this we:

>

> 1. Added accessibilityPrivate.showToast(), so that the dictation

> extension can request the toast to be shown.

> 2. Added AccessibilityNotificationController, which manages showing

> the toast.

>

> [1] https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1mRnYcRpyzbY-EjzptCP3KRB5I7v_rM9Kl2zqhhQVZUY/edit#slide=id.g24cce1f4158_0_12
